info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 4:14AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Burke and Caldwell. * WHEN...Until 715 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 409 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to earlier thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain fell Saturday evening, which has caused Lower Creek to rise above bankfull in some locations. - In particular, the stream gage on Lower Creek at Lenoir had reached 10.62 feet at 4 am and was rising slowly. Flood stage is 11 feet. High water conditions will continue along Lower Creek as it flows down into northern Burke County and the water will eventually recede in the pre-dawn hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lenoir and Gamewell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
